item.title: Qiana add a quote by Edward P. Jones
item.description: "We are all worthy of one another." -- Edward P. Jones

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "The presence of evil was something to be first recognized, then dealt with, survived, outwitted, triumphed over." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Qiana add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "For, while the tale of how we suffer, and how we are delighted, and how we may triumph is never new, it always must be heard. There isn't any other tale to tell, it's the only light we've got in all this darkness." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Colson Whitehead
item.description: "Colored, Negro, Afro-American, African American. ... Every couple of years someone came up with something that got us an inch closer to the truth. Bit by bit we crept along. As if that thing we believed to be approaching actually existed." -- Colson Whitehead

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Oh, Celie, unbelief is a terrible thing. And so is the hurt we cause others unknowingly." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "My head was full of misty fumes of doubt." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "In war you lose your sense of the definite, hence your sense of truth itself, and therefore it's safe to say that in a war story nothing is ever absolutely true." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "It was a fine cry - loud and long - but it had no bottom and it had no top, just circles and circles of sorrow." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It was sort of like <i>Macbeth</i>, thought Fat Charlie, an hour later; in fact, if the witches in <i>Macbeth</i> had been four little old ladies and if, instead of stirring cauldrons and intoning dread incantations, they had just welcomed Macbeth in and fed him turkey and rice and peas spread out on white china plates on a red-and-white patterned plastic tablecloth -- not to mention sweet potato pudding and spice cabbage -- and encouraged him to take second helpings, and thirds, and then, when Macbeth had declaimed that nay, he was stuffed nigh unto bursting and on his oath could truly eat no more, the witches had pressed upon him their own special island rice pudding and a large slice of Mrs. Bustamonte's famous pineapple upside-down cake, it would have been exactly like <i>Macbeth</i>." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Doris May Lessing
item.description: "There is no doubt fiction makes a better job of the truth." -- Doris May Lessing

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Grant Morrison
item.description: "Enough madness? Enough? And how do you measure madness? - The Joker" -- Grant Morrison

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Hunger has always been more or less at my elbow when I played, but now I began to wake up at night to find hunger standing at my bedside, staring at my gauntly." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "I shall create! If not a note, a hole./If not an overture, a desecration." -- Gwendolyn Brooks

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "What, what am I to do with all of this life?" -- Gwendolyn Brooks

item.title: Qiana add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "The imperfect is our paradise." -- Wallace Stevens
